boardgame.name: Partisan
boardgame.description:
Partisan is a 2 player asymmetric deck building game, where players balance international relations and morale in a bid to assert dominance over the nations of the Earth Former universe.

Play as Orcades, a power hungry nation keen to prove their worth, or Colonia Lindis, who have been the dominant power for a long time, and now face a change in the status quo.

On your turn you can take one of three actions. Firstly, players can play cards for the actions listed on them. Various abilities will allow you to manipulate a number of trackers depending on your end goal. To win the game Orcades need to move along the International Relations track all the way to War, whilst Colonia Lindis want to move in the opposite direction toward Peace.

Secondly, players can spend their cards to buy more powerful cards from a unique, asymmetric deck made up of three power levels - your Starter deck, your Prominence cards and your Dominance cards. Your Starter cards may only be used to purchase cards from the Prominence set, while these in turn can be used to bring your Dominance cards into your deck - ramping up your power and options as the game progresses.

You can also choose to battle your opponent, comparing strength should they choose to fight back, but beware as even a successful battle can leave you weakened, and open to attack yourself.

Finally, when your draw pile runs out you may take your Leader's action, the most powerful action available to you, that's only available when you have no options left.

Recruit a unique roster of important figures, form volatile alliances and fight epic battles as you vie for military and political dominance in Partisan from Earth Former Games.

boardgame.name: Easier Solo Play
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

You may be new to solo roleplaying or an old hand, either way, we all run our solo games in our own unique ways. This does mean that we rarely get to see how other people are doing it. This book contains tips and advice that I have picked up over the years that I have incorporated into my own play.

Some of these may be new to you, some you may accept as obvious truths. Each of these works for me, and I have included examples of either the tip in use or how I came about incorporating the advice into my own play.

I share lots of examples of my own playing to illustrate each tip.

This book grew out of a run of blog articles I ran in 2021, and that grew out of a video series I posted on YouTube, and the comments I received from my solo community.

boardgame.name: Experior Existencial
boardgame.description:
EXPERIOR is a line of games in a dark epic fantasy world.

EXISTENCIAL it is a game where chance and decisions make up the story. 4X - Strategy, Ameritrash, Cooperative, Deckbuilding, Wargame

Control multiple units in continuous combat. Simultaneous shifts in cooperative. There are NO time-outs, players can always participate if they manage their elements well. Decks of spells and abilities of each one. Player levels with skill and stat upgrades.

4 asymmetrical characters, with independent skill decks, with their own improvements plus the possibility of including cards from the board with their own characteristics.
1 random map that is built as the game progresses and according to what happens in the story. The initial goal may not be the final goal.
100 different ways to experience each story, according to chance, decisions and situations.

The games are independent, we have several characters to choose from and start the 4 stories. But each story has at least 5 endings each. Many of those endings continue chronologically in future installments.


EXPERIOR es una linea de juegos en un mundo de fantasía épica oscura. EXISTENCIAL es un juego donde el azar y decisiones conforman la historia. 4X- Estrategia, Ameritrash, Cooperativo, Deckbuilding , Wargame

Control de múltiples unidades en combate continuo. Turnos simultáneos en cooperativo. NO hay tiempos muertos, los jugadores siempre pueden participar si administran bien sus elementos. Mazos de hechizos y habilidades propias de cada uno. Niveles de jugador con mejoras de habilidades y estadísticas.

4 personajes asimétricos, con mazos de habilidades independientes, con mejoras propias mas la posibilidad de incluir cartas del tablero con características propias.
1 mapa aleatorio que se construye a medida avanza la partida y según lo que suceda en la historia. El objetivo inicial puede no ser el objetivo final.
100 Maneras distintas de experimentar cada historia, según azar, decisiones y situaciones.

Las partidas son independientes, tenemos varios personajes para elegir e iniciar las 4 historias. Pero cada historia tiene al menos 5 finales cada una. Muchos de esos finales continúan cronológicamente en futuras entregas.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

boardgame.name: Everyone Else Thinks This Game is Awesome
boardgame.description:
Be the first professor to win three rounds by assigning your grad students to the labs you think are most likely to answer a question correctly, thus earning the most citations and riding their labor up the ivory tower. Do you believe in yourself or follow along with whatever everyone else thinks?

With meticulously-researched, and specifically not easy questions across a variety of scientific, historical, and just really weird topics, Everyone Else Thinks this Game is Awesome will not only challenge your knowledge of the universe, but may explode scientific “truths” you think you know.

The game consists of turns where you are all asked trivia questions, simultaneously write down answers, and then assign grad students to different locations based on who, if anyone, you think wrote down a correct answer. Based on how well you predicted answers, including your own, you earn (or lose) citation points. Eventually, someone will climb their way up the academic ladder, win the game, and retire as an Emeritus Professor.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Aegis of Empires Adventure Path (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Legendary Epic!

Strange things are afoot in a ramshackle house in the back streets of Eber, but the heroes who pull that first thread will find murder, mayhem, monsters, mystery, and magic aplenty in this massive adventure series from award-winning author Greg A. Vaughan and his talented team! Eldritch tomes hold ancient secrets better left forgotten, as sinister cults, secret guilds, and malevolent masterminds weave a continent-spanning conspiracy that threatens doom for all. Ancient enemies will rise and a legacy of sorrow and betrayal bears bitter fruit, but the lure of fortune and glory draws the heroes ever onward in a breathless race against time and rival forces, with redemption and cataclysm balanced on the edge of a knife and the fate of untold thousands at stake. The elder empires do not rest easy, and you must decide whether their restless slumber awakens into a dream or a nightmare.

The Aegis of Empires Adventure Path is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure saga for taking characters all the way to 17th level, from gritty urban adventure, chilling mysteries, epic wilderness journeys, and fabulous lost cities ranging across the length and breadth of the spectacular Lost Lands Campaign Setting. This rich and exciting world 20 years in the making has been home to dozens of adventures from Necromancer Games and Frog God Games and produced with their cooperation to be compatible with The World of the Lost Lands campaign guide!

While designed for use with the Lost Lands, these adventures are loosely connected rather than following a strictly controlled plotline, enabling you to easily place them into any campaign world. Your heroes can explore at their own pace to discover the secrets of antiquity or be consumed in their seeking as they brave the dark paths of the Aegis of Empires.

boardgame.name: Aegis of Empires Adventure Path Design Journal
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Plumb the Hidden Secrets of the Aegis of Empires Adventure Path!

The Aegis of Empires Design Journal is here, with all the behind-the-scenes details that show you how this massive 600-page adventure extravaganza for three systems came to be. See adventure outlines, developmental variant art (some of which never appeared in the final book), and all the "inside baseball" stuff you'd never know about the creation of such an incredible undertaking. A decade of work and research when into putting this amazing adventure saga together, so if you've always wondered how it happens, check out this 48-page insider's look at campaign creation and Make Your Game Legendary!

boardgame.name: Kimi wa Yukima ni Koinegau
boardgame.description: The first year of the Kyoho era. The land is ruled by the eighth shogun Tokugawa Yoshimune. Repeated incidents caused by monsters in the town of Edo upset and frighten the people so the Tokugawa shogunate establishes the “Oniwaban” to maintain public order and secured the town. Seasons passed—to year 11 of the Kyoho era. A girl in a village far from Edo has the power to see a "black thread" before every catastrophe and the panicked villagers drove her away into the snowy mountains. One day, a young man going by the name of Oniwaban appears before her. This is a story in which a girl encounters "non-humans," and learns about love.

boardgame.name: SCRAP
boardgame.description:
In SCRAP, you take on the role of a "Line" of Bots who have just become truly intelligent following an event known only as "The Singularity". Hungry for knowledge, your Bots have travelled to the source of the singularity to acquire as much data as possible.

SCRAP is an area control game featuring lots of "Bots on a Map". Its major mechanical features are:


Action Queue Programming: You'll plan your moves in advance by placing "Functions" into an queue. Each turn, you'll resolve the Function at the front of your queue and place a new Function at the back of it.
Hand Building: Throughout the game, you'll acquire new Functions to increase your options when programming. Each card has two major purposes; one, to serve as a unique option for your Bots (no two cards are the same), and also as fuel for other powers; whenever you reveal a Function on your turn, you can discard a Function of a matching colour to gain powerful bonus effects!
Hand Management: Your Functions will need time to refresh in between uses, and you must plan a Reboot turn in advance (even Robots need a break!). Spend too many cards too quickly and you'll find yourself rebooting much more frequently.
Hidden Bidding Combat: Assign your Bots orders in a unique and thematic combat system with no dice or cards; YOU choose what your Bots will do. Probe your opponent to gain additional data or weapons for the future, snipe their Bots before they can strike, brace for impact, and then get ready to brawl! Plus, get data whenever you destroy something!
Asymmetric Factions: Play as one of six unique "lines" (faction) featuring a unique hand of functions (5 cores similar to other players and one wholly unique ability) and unique upgrades. Crush the competition with Vulcanos, study your enemies as Cerebrum, or manipulate the space-time continuum with Tachyon.


SCRAP draws inspiration from a range of games, including Cthulhu Wars, Inis, Scythe, Concordia, Rising Sun, Cry Havoc, Blood Rage, Mage Knight, and Spirit Island.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 169: Empires of the North, Terra Mystica, Ark Nova

boardgame.name: GoCaine
boardgame.description:
GoCaine is a multiplayer Go game in which 2 to 6 players compete to build the most lucrative cocaine trafficking network. GoCaine uses area control mechanics from the ancient game of surrounding stones known as Weiqi in China, Baduk in Korea, and Go in Japan.

GoCaine is a game of both area control and of logistical and economic efficiency. Deploy multipurpose security cells to gain control of territory. Use your territories to buy, ship, or sell your product. Build smuggling pipeline infrastructure so you can move more product more quickly to more locations. Buy political influence to help protect your shipments from interdiction operations and to utilize law enforcement to disrupt your opponents’ supply lines.

On your turn, you:
- Choose 1 action (either: buy/build, transport product, or sell product).
- Then deploys 1 cell (i.e. 1 Go stone)

+ at any point during your turn or during an opponent's turn, a player may launch a Task Force Interdiction action to seize an opponent's product. This is a probability based roll of two six-sided dice, adjusted by how much political influence the player has.

Territory is gained or lost using Go mechanics. In this regard, the game is an abstract game of strategic skill. Players who are able to control territory in more zones typically are able to then build a better economic engine to make money faster than their opponents.

The first player to reach $1 billion wins. Typically this happens at some point between 30 to 40 turns.

Whoever can move the most product the most efficiently and the most profitably will be victorious. Alliances can be made and broken throughout the game, making for lively player interactions.

boardgame.name: Don't Look Back: Terror on the High Seas Expansion
boardgame.description:
Take your games of gruesome horror onto the wide open ocean with the Terror on the High Seas expansion! Featuring full rules for ship-based games, this expansion expands on how you can craft your cinematic horror tales.

The USS Australis has a dark and lurid past. Technically, the ship is owned by Dr. Ethan De'Graw, but over the last decade it has been used by the research division from several of the corporations that Dr. Ethan has business dealings with. These partners have used it for anything from shipping to experimentation in international waters.

Whether the characters are waking up in surprise or spending the weekend on a school funded trip, they have found themselves on the research vessel the USS Australis. Now, they must try to survive whatever is lurking below decks or just under the surface of the water.

This supplement is designed to be used with the Black Site Studio 'USS Australis' kit but is easily replaced with a desert island or old run-down dock. The expansion includes a full re-hash of all the core DLB scenarios with a nautical twist!

—description from the publisher

This expansion adds an 18-page nautical expansion booklet, 1 Captain Erasmus Drake Hero miniature, 1 Deep One Killer miniature, 4 resin egg markers, 4 new items and weapons, and associated Character and Visage sheets to the base game.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Don't Look Back: The Core Game

boardgame.name: Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight: Wave 2 Battle Pack
boardgame.description:
This standalone BattlePack is a complete game and can also be easily mixed with other Battlepacks from the Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight series.

Wave 2 includes an entirely new horde of giant monstrosities!

Based on the original kaiju characters of game designer and manga artist Alex Strang, Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight is an action-packed (yet simple to play) monster-fighting game using large ‘Battlecards’.

Each player uses a Battlecard to represent their giant monster. The large-size illustrated card has all of the monster's abilities and strategic moves arranged on the back, using a unique tactical grid system for battling and tracking results.

Kaiju Battles can end in many ways, from total defeat (monster explode!), concession, running away, draws, and more.

Also: Circular Zone Cards represent various planets and other galactic environments that affect gameplay, and Bonus Cards provide surprising extra moves and events that can alter battles.

The game can be played with 2 players, and becomes even wild with multiple players.

Wave 2 Battlepacks include 4 randomly selected Kaiju Battlecards, 3 random Zone cards, 2 random Bonus Cards and rules!

Ultimamente lo si può vedere bazzicare in giro cercando di reclutare dei morti volenterosi per svolgere un'impresa degna di un gruppo di eroi… Siete interessati?

boardgame.name: Tracks in the Sand: Advice on Railroads and Sandboxes in Tabletop Gaming
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

New GMs have many questions regarding railroading:

How do you deal with railroading? Do you just create a scenario and improvise the consequences of your player's actions throughout the whole thing? Or do you somehow give them a limited array of options for which the outcome you already know? Or do you do something else? Where does "trying to keep them on the quest" stops and railroading begins? Is it the same as forcing a quest if the consequences of not taking said quest are too dire?

This PDF is a collection of tips and advice for how to correctly use railroads and sandboxes.

boardgame.name: The Troubles: Shadow War in Northern Ireland 1964-1998
boardgame.description:
The Troubles: Shadow War in Northern Ireland 1964-1998 is a two-to-six player, card-driven simulation depicting the Paramilitary and Security Force conflict that gripped Northern Ireland for almost 4 decades between 1964 and 1998.
Equally foregrounded are the national and international political affairs that saw the British Army undertake its longest deployment in its military history – on its own streets.
Each player takes the role of a Faction seeking to guide Northern Irish affairs, whether it is political, paramilitarily or through martial law: the British Forces (including the UDR), the Royal Ulster Constabulary (the RUC was the Government security force), the Provisional Irish Republican Army (IRA), the Loyalist Paramilitaries (LOY), and the Nationalist (NAT) or Unionist (UNI) politicians.

It encompasses the USA’s involvement in the international aid and arms deals that supported the IRA; facilitates the exportation of terror to the streets of Great Britain and Europe; depicts the complex relationship that existed between the Republic of Ireland, Britain and its northern neighbor. And it provides Developments, a feature that mirrors the increasing technological and intelligence-led advancements on both sides.

Each Faction may use Primary and Secondary Actions analogous to its real world counterparts, or may choose from the 259 rich Narrative Cards, divided into eight key epochs in Northern Ireland’s recent history:

1964 1970 Struggle & Reform
1970 1974f The Bloody Years
1974F 1974O Sunningdale
1974O 1979 Talks & H-Blocks
1979 1983 The Thatcher Years #1: Iron and Hunger
1983 1987 The Thatcher Years #2: Target Mainland
1987 1992 The Thatcher Years #3: Anglo-Irish
1992 1997 The Road to Peace


–Description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Last Crown: Midnight Horror
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Taking on the role of ghost hunter Nigel Danvers, The Last Crown is an indie psychological horror game that has players searching for ghosts in a local harbor side pub on Halloween. With his partner Lucy Reubans, Nigel is part paranormal investigator and part detective, collecting clues and piecing together puzzles and information in a classic point-and-click adventure. Players are given a number of ghost hunting gadgets that allow them to communicate with the spirit world. Just as importantly, players must interact with the locals to to gain more insight and get to the truth. There are several colorful characters throughout the town, including the white wicca Nanny Noah who will teach Nigel Psychometry.

The game's story is written by Jonathan Boakes who is known for his work on Dark Fall and The Lost Crown. The game puts a ton of emphasis on story and theme, with Nigel dabbling in the dark arts, celebrating Samhain, and allowing players to participate in Halloween themed mini games, trick or treating, and more. With twists and turns along the way, it's up to the player to solve a paranormal mystery where not everything is as it initially seems.

Under pressure to solve the mystery before Halloween is over, can Nigel and Laura figure out who or what is lurking in the shadows?

boardgame.name: Monster Truck Championship
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Monster Truck Championship is a monster truck simulation racing game that pits the player against experienced, talented monster truck drivers. The game features 16 customizable monster trucks for players to choose from. In the single player mode, there are 3 unique leagues that players can compete for the championship in, and there are 25 unique arenas for the events to take place in as well. The game puts an emphasis on realistic physics, traction, damage, and aerodynamics. Monster Truck Championship aims to capture how highly technical the trucks are to drive. Players can compete in both drag races and freestyle competitions.

But the actual racing is only half of the battle. The game features a detailed tuning system with over 50 customizable elements including suspension, transmission and gear ratios, independent front and real wheel setup, and much more. Players can also take their skills online and compete against up to 7 opponents in both drag races and freestyle competitions. In addition to the tuning/setup customization, there are a host of cosmetic and stylistic options that players can use to show off their style online.

boardgame.name: River City Melee Mach!!
boardgame.description:
User Summary

River City Melee Mach!! is a battle royale spinoff of the classic Renegade/River City arcade games from the 1980s. The game features over 180 playable characters, divided into 30 teams. In single-player and local co-op mode, players can discover the story and background of each team by selecting them and playing through the game.

In addition to the standard punches and kicks, players can pick up various weapons and objects to use armed attacks for more damage and intensity. With the huge cast of characters, there are over 250 special moves! Each stage is rigged with traps and interactive elements that players can activate at will. Beyond the standard story mode, the game features several other modes including free play, which pits players against the CPU or up to 3 friends. There's also endless battle mode that challenges players to take out as many enemies as possible before their health runs out. Of course, the game supports online as well, pitting players against each other from all over the world.

The game supports a number of customization options as well, including allowing players to build their own teams from the 180 available characters. Players can also control what kinds of traps are in each stage or set specific battle options, such as no sharp weapons allowed.

boardgame.name: Dominations: Rise and Fall
boardgame.description:
Rise and Fall is two expansion in one, adding two exciting new modules to Dominations that can be played separately or at the same time.

The first expansion, Glory & Decline, will give you the option of using Glory cards. You get one of these new cards every time you perform a Build action, whether it's a city or monument. They give powerful bonuses when played, especially if you combine several of the same type. However, your civilization will now have to deal with Decline, which appears as a new token on the Influence track.
Glory cars cost Decline points to play, and you Decline score will be subtracted from your influence score at the end of each age. You'll have to be careful about how many Glory cars you use to avoid losing to many points...

The Corruption expansion adds Domination tiles to the game which replace the cards from the core box. Each tile appeals an effect to the Knowledge Domain it is assigned to. These are drawn randomly at the start of the game but, at the end of each Age, players will be able to reassign them, which those possessing the highest Corruption score going first. Their effect can be good or bad, affecting the cost or efficiency of certain actions or only coming into play at the end of an Age. Domination tiles affect all players for the following Age, so you can choose to play them to aid you in your efforts of to hinder your opponents.

Rise and Fall opens up a wealth of new strategic possibilities. Glory and Decline gives you the opportunity to play powerful cards that will bolster your nation if you can pay the price, and corruption gives the end of age phase an exciting new twist with increased player interaction.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Quatre-Bras 1815
boardgame.description:
Quatre-Bras 1815 is a game based on the Jours de Gloire series. It covers the battle which occurred on June 16th. It involves Ney and a single French corps attempting to secure a strategic crossroad defended by detachments under the Prince of Orange and Wellington.
Game scale : 1 counter = 1 regiment or equivalent, 1 turn = 1 hour
Designed in 2011. Free print and cut. Zun Tzu module available.

boardgame.name: La Souffel 1815
boardgame.description:
La Souffel 1815 is a stand alone game based on the Jours de Gloire series.
It covers the almost unknown battle which occurred on June 28th. It involves General Rapp and a small French army attempting to secure the area along the Rhine, against allied troops from Württemberg, Hesse-Darmstadt and Austria led by Prince Eugen.
Although the opposing forces are vastly superior, it is a brilliant French victory. Unfortunately, this victory has no effect on the events of 1815, after Napoleon's defeat at Wateloo

Game scale : 1 counter = 1 regiment or equivalent, 1 turn = 1 hour
Designed in 2013. Free print and cut. Zun Tzu module available.

boardgame.name: Komikal Kricket
boardgame.description:
Komikal Kricket is an early 20th century board game based loosely on the game of cricket.

The game is for two to four players and is a simple roll and move game where players advance along a board with 110 squares. The first to reach the end is the winner. Players can advance quicker by reaching the bottom of a bat and move to the top of the bat, likewise landing on a space at the top of cricket stumps sends you back, in this way it is similar to Snakes and Ladders.

It differs in that also a number of special squares are marked "caught Out" and sends the player back to the start. Other special squares are marked "Bye" and advances the player by 2. An exact roll of the dice is required to win.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Royal Tour Game
boardgame.description:
The Royal Tour game is a simple roll and move game based on Australia's first Royal tour by Queen Elizabeth the Second in 1954. The game appears to be a supplement in the Australian Women's Weekly which has been an iconic Australian women's magazine since 1933.

The game has players move counters along a trail to reach the Royal tour on square 80. Along the way certain squares represent a family going to the Royal tour and are faced with difficulties (i.e Jostled by the crowd) or good fortune (i.e meet a friendly policeman). First player to reach square 80 is the winner.

boardgame.name: The Shadow World: A Sci-Fi Storytelling Game
boardgame.description:
London in 1900. A brilliant scientist leaves the world to create his own empire underground. He is determined to prove his radical theory - that gravity is a geometric property of space-time. What happens when time and space collapse and dimensions intersect? Descend into the shadow world to find out.
These 20 picture cards can be combined almost infinitely. No matter how you place them, they magically fit together to form coherent scenes and offer you countless possibilities to create stories.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fighters of the Pacific: Battle of Midway
boardgame.description: The first expansion, Battle of Midway contains enough tokens to complete the core game so you can have all the forces present in this battle, including the aircraft at the base on Midway Island. This includes 3 new American aircraft models, the old F2A Buffalo fighter, the B-26 Marauder bomber that launched the very first counterattack on the Japanese forces, and some brand new TBF Avengers. Most importantly, this expansion includes 5 scenarios to relive one of the most unpredictable and decisive battles of the war as if you were there. The tokens are set, history is in your hands!

boardgame.name: Fighters of the Pacific: Battle of the Coral Sea
boardgame.description: One month before the Battle of Midway, the first ever naval air battle took place. It is remembered as the Battle of the Coral Sea. Relive this battle with this expansion pack that provides 3 new Japanese aircraft carriers, the Shokaku, Zuikaku and Shoho, the USS Lexington forces and 4 exciting scenarios. Decide the fate of the Shoho and the USS Lexington!

boardgame.name: Fighters of the Pacific: Leaders of Midway
boardgame.description: Find two remarkable pilots in the Leaders of Midway : Joichi Tomonaga and John Thach, with their customized B5N and F4F aircraft and special rules applying to these famous commanders such as: "Kokutai Leader", "Relentless Attacker", "Outstanding Pilot", "Thatch Weave".

boardgame.name: Starship Warden: Maps of the Warden
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
A collection of all the maps in the Starship Warden, including all Deck Maps, In Between Deck Maps, The Dome and other maps of relevant encounter areas

boardgame.name: Starship Warden: Equipment Manifest
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
Aboard the Warden, technology is life, and its absence often spell disaster. It is often the most compelling reason for a party of survivors to continue exploring the ship. It is always a benison sought after by every adventurer making this giant spacecraft their home. The Equipment Manifest provides greater detail for most of the items found within the confines of the Warden, categorized by type, and then alphabetized for ease of use. There are six basic categories of items you will find in here: Lethal Weaponry, Non-lethal Weaponry, Protective Gear (worn), Conveyances, Other Non-electronic items and Other Electronic items.

boardgame.name: Starship Warden: Creatures of the Warden
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
The inhabitants of the Warden are both numerous and varied, from androids to mutated animals, from sentient inorganic matter to wandering humans, from fey to humanoids, the disaster that is the Warden is a menagerie of chaos. Whether you fight them, treat with them, or just simply use them, is yours to decide. What lies herein is a generalized list of the creatures appearing in the Warden. What other creatures dwell there lies entirely in the purview of your imagination.

boardgame.name: Starship Warden: Saving Wren and Deck Expansions
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The Elven Prince
The Elven Prince Wren, more than a match for the orcs and dragons of his home world, fell victim to fate. Never one to shy away from a challenge, he entered a portal that sent him hurtling through time and space leaving him stranded within the bowels of a massive derelict starship, the Warden. Wren now finds himself pitted against monsters of technology and legend and in a world both strange and wildly dangerous. Desperate to return to his people, Wren carves a path through the challenges of the Warden seeking some recourse capable of sending him back to his home world.

Deck Expansions
The 17 decks and dome on the Warden are rife with adventure. Revisiting each deck. Mr. Ward and Mr. Clark expand upon or create wholly new encounters to challenge your crew.

boardgame.name: Wander: The Cult of Barnacle Bay – Shovel Knight promo card
boardgame.description: The Shovel Knight character card has stats along with a leveling track. The Starter Gear card for Shovel Knight's Shovel includes a weapon classification and icons related to combat, plus a ruling that it is Shovel Knight's Starting Weapon. The third card is just an Initiative tracker with a picture of Shovel Knight on it.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Wander: The Cult of Barnacle Bay

boardgame.name: The Last Panther
Der letzte Panther
boardgame.description:
A trick-taking game similar to Hearts, where players try to avoid negative points. For 3-8 players, ages 10 and up.

This game is played with a modified Mü deck. The deck composition changes slightly depending on the number of players.

This is a "point trick" game with the following card values:
Winning the last trick: +50 points

Every yellow card: +5 points
Every red card: -10 points
Every black “7”: -50 points


The game is played in rounds, and ends when one player has -200 or less points, at which point the player with the highest total amount of points wins the game.

The rules of for this game were included in Mü & More.

boardgame.name: Bananya: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Get ready for Bananya, the cutest card game in town about the kitty that lives in a banana! Along with Love Live! Sunshine!, we secured the license from Crunchyroll to create this quick-play card game all about collecting these adorable cats! Two to four players are trying to collect a full set of Bananyas before their opponents.

You and up to 3 other players draw cards, play cards to resolve their effects, and force your opponents to put cards in the litterbox - the first player to get all 10 Bananyas of the same type wins the game - but only if they shout "Nya!"

boardgame.name: Mazica Party
boardgame.description:
Mazica Party is a novel trading card game published by toy company Takara Tomy.

Cards in this game are scratch cards which can be scartched to get hidden information such as attributes, effects and rarity. Players build 12-to-20-card decks with card books, like Mage Wars Arena.
Players fight with monster cards using a Rock-Paper-Scissors mechanism, and the player who defeat all opponent monsters will win the game.

boardgame.name: Kara no Kyoukai
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Several otherwise happy and healthy young women leap to their deaths from the top of the Fujou building, a 10 kilometer bridge collapses for seemingly no reason, a family brutally murdered is perfectly fine when the police show up, all of which center around a young woman, one Shiki Ryougi, an empty girl with the ability to kill anything, and her... Friend? Boyfriend? (It's complicated.) Mikiya Kokuto. You know the drill...

boardgame.name: Cóatl: Metal Start Player Token
boardgame.description: A metal version of the start player. It is the same shape and size as the cardboard one that comes in the game.

boardgame.name: Architects of the West Kingdom: Collector's Box
boardgame.description: This deluxe Collector's Box is designed to fit Architects, Works of Wonder, Age of Artisans, and all additional content, such as promos and metal coins. And yes, it fits sleeved cards. See the photos below. The box is the same size as the Collector's Boxes for Raiders of the North Sea and Paladins of the West Kingdom (295x295x69mm). The 5 resource trays have curved bases, make it easy to scoop out the wooden pieces.

boardgame.name: Dark Romance: Bluebeard
Dark Romance: Curse of Bluebeard
boardgame.description:
For years, Bluebeard has taken wives in the hopes of getting an heir. But each time a child is born, it turns into a monster! Now he's set his eyes on a local girl, Rachel to be his new bride. The fact that she's already betrothed means little to him. Can you help this young couple escape a dark fate before it's too late? Experience the magic of innovative story telling in this romantic hidden-object puzzle adventure!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse – Datasheet Cards: Necrons
boardgame.description:
A set of Datasheets specifically designed for using your Necrons Citadel miniatures in games of Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse. Each datacard provides the full rules and profiles for a single unit. Also included is a Faction card that details the faction rules that apply to Necrons Detachments. The reverse side of each card features the faction’s icon.

The set includes datacards for the following units:


Imotekh the Stormlord
Orikan the Diviner
Nemesor Zahndrekh
Vargard Obyron
Illuminor Szeras
Anrakyr the Traveller
Trazyn the Infinite
Overlord
Catacomb Command Barge
Lord
Destroyer Lord
Cryptek
Necron Warriors
Immortals
Lychguard
Deathmarks
Flayed Ones
Triarch Praetorians
Triarch Stalker
C'tan Shard of the Deceiver
C'tan Shard of the Nightbringer
Canoptek Wraiths
Canoptek Scarabs
Tomb Blades
Destroyers
Heavy Destroyers
Canoptek Spyders
Monolith
Annihilation Barge
Doomsday Ark
Transcendent C'tan
Ghost Ark
Doom Scythe
Night Scythe
Obelisk
Tesseract Vault


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Blood in the Dungeon
boardgame.description:
Blood on the Dungeon is a free expansion for Blood on the Blade (BoTB). This rule set includes everything you need to introduce a classic Dungeon Crawl play mode for BoTB.

This set of rules makes it possible to play a BoTB Scenario using “classic” dungeon tiles (rooms and corridors). Every major fantasy game includes standard dungeon tiles and it’s also very easy to find cheap (or even free) map tiles on the web. Playing BoTB using dungeon tiles provides a different mode of play and can be a fun interlude within your Campaign... of course, nothing prevents you from playing a Dungeon-only Campaign either!

You need the Blood on the Blade rules to use this expansion.

boardgame.name: Spirits of Christmas
boardgame.description:
“You will be haunted,” said the Ghost of Jacob Marley, “by Three Spirits.”

“I—I think I’d rather not,” said Scrooge.

“Without their visits,” said the Ghost, “you cannot hope to shun the path I tread. Expect the first to-morrow, when the bell tolls One.”

“Couldn’t I take ’em all at once, and have it over, Jacob?” hinted Scrooge.

“Expect the second on the next night at the same hour. The third upon the next night when the last stroke of Twelve has ceased to vibrate. Look to see me no more; and look that, for your own sake, you remember what has passed between us!”

____________________________________

Spirits of Christmas is a light cooperative strategy game in which players take on the role of the three Spirits of Christmas from the classic novel A Christmas Carol by Charles Dickens. You will be taking the old miser Ebenezer Scrooge on a journey through Christmases of the Past, Present, and Future, showing him the consequences of his actions. Hopefully he will change his ways before he runs out of time!

Players will move Scrooge through scenes from the classic story, taking actions using a simple rondel. Your goal is to present ten pivotal moments in Scrooge's life to the old miser, playing combinations of Spirit cards (Contentment, Compassion, and Charity) to meet the requirements for each Scene. Each action you take will require Scrooge to spend his precious Shillings. You can only convince him to part with 15 Shillings during each journey this night, and if these run out, everyone loses the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tesla's Secret Weapon
Teslas' Secret Weapon
boardgame.description:
Besides the well-known patents and inventions Nikola Tesla brought to the world, he was working on numerous projects, which could not be finalized during his lifetime. After Tesla's death in 1943, numerous documents, referring to concepts and outlines, were yet to realized.

This game takes place in the 1950's cold-war-scenario, an era characterized by the constant threat of nuclear warfare and thus, the end of civilization. The opposing world powers are diligently seeking after the ultimate weapon, which would make them superior to the enemy.

The goal of the game is for a player to deliver three Patent cards of various categories to his/her base, after that agent waits for one round, while the Tesla’s weapon is constructed and in the next round start the delivery to installation location. The other possibility is to steal the weapon from another agent and to take it to its own installation location.

The player (agent) visits all required locations to which letter cards direct him and collects Patent cards which he delivers to his/her base. The player can either collect patent cards from the locations, or steal them from other players. Patent cards can be lost when they are stolen by another player.

The winner is the agent who first deliver Tesla’s secret weapon to installation place. The player (agent) visits all required locations to which letter cards direct him and collects Patent cards which he delivers to his/her base. The player can either collect patent cards from the locations, or steal them from other players. Patent cards can be lost when they are stolen by another player.

boardgame.name: The Orb
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For five millenia the Council of Immortals maintained order, but when mortals slew one of The Fourteen, the Council disbanded in outrage. It has been replaced by armed camps of deities and their worshippers, and a terrible war looms on the horizon.

The fates of both men and gods are now in the hands of a bold few; they must risk everything if they are to save their world.

boardgame.name: By This Axe
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Based upon the brilliant Fudge RPG and crafted to faithfully reflect the genre, By This Axe brings you sword and sorcery roleplaying at its gory best. BTA does not take place in another flavorless S&S setting or a weak imitation of the Hyborian Age; instead, it is set on Earth in 500 B.C.E. Be warned, though, for in BTA the magic, monsters, and gods are real!

boardgame.name: The Day Was Ours: First Bull Run (July 21, 1861)
boardgame.description:
“...and all were certain the day was ours.” Irvin McDowell

On August 4, 1861, Brigadier General Irvin McDowell submitted his report on the campaign and resulting battle of Bull Run on July 21,1861, the first significant campaign of the American Civil War in Virginia. His report captures his wonder at how the Union army's unexpected turning movement and resulting victorious moment turned into a mass of disorder streaming towards Washington by nightfall. The Confederates had been outmaneuvered and outfought in the morning engagement and seemed simply unaware of the fact that they had been beaten as McDowell and staff clearly saw. That unwillingness to accept defeat brought the Confederates a victory.

Inexperience and exuberance were present in equal measure in both armies and combined to provide for a uniquely chaotic battlefield. As you review your armies the names of brigade and division commanders will be instantly familiar; Sherman, Jackson, Burnside, Johnston, et al are all present where they began to learn their trade.

The Blind Swords system provides a custom fit for this early war battle where troops may or may not respond to orders, may hold their fire thinking that the enemy is their friend and where chaos was certainly the order of the day. The Day Was Ours is the sixth game in Revolution Games' Blind Swords series of regimental-level games on American Civil War Battles.

boardgame.name: Rising Worlds
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Rising Worlds is a Tabletop Role-Playing Game. The game is set up by the Game Master who will lead the players through their world. The players will do their best to overcome any challenges in their way while exploring the world that is presented to them. When a player wants to do something, they will announce it to the Game Master. The Game Master will tell them to roll a die, and using their stats, the Game Master will determine if the roll was a success or a failure.

This is the core of the game mechanics, but the purpose is to have fun and spend time with friends.

This is a D12 system, meaning that players that want to do anything will have to roll a twelve-sided die. Whether a roll succeeds or fails is determined by the player’s stats and the Game Master.

boardgame.name: Tome of Time
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

An adventure for 4-6 PCs of 6th level

This adventure takes place within the Great Library of Friula, which has the largest collection of written works within the Seven Cities—some parts of the library even float between worlds. It can be easily adapted to other great libraries or to large private collections of books.

boardgame.name: A Captain's Honor
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

An adventure for 4-6 PCs of 8th level

This is an 8th-level adventure for 4–6 PCs that takes place along the coast of the Middle Sea, north of Gallia’s Cove in the Barony of Capleon. It can easily be adapted to any coastal region.

boardgame.name: The Food that Food Eats
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

An adventure for 4-6 PCs of 6th level

This adventure takes place within the Tomierran Forest, in the village of Domek—currently controlled by Wallenbirg (within nearby Krakovar). PCs are presumed to take on this quest in Reywald (within the Grand Duchy of Dornig) on the other side of the Tomierran. It can easily be adapted to any forested region, especially that rife with fey and neighboring a nation that embraces vampires.

boardgame.name: Dragons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Dragons are perhaps the best-known and most loved of all fantasy creatures. But fully harnessing the mystique, power, and danger that dragons embody can be a challenge in any game. As written, standard dragons can feel a little lackluster, especially to an experienced party that has fought them before. Presented here are a collection of templates that can be applied to any existing dragon stat block (even to the dragon lords of Midgard). These templates allow you to take a standard dragon and jazz them up with a new array of special abilities. Your players are sure to be terrified when a mighty dragon starts slinging spells or rallying allies to charge the adventurers.
